'''Activism''' consists of intentional action to bring about [[social change|social]], [[politics|political]], [[economics|economic]], or [[Natural environment|environmental]] change. Activism can take a wide range of forms from writing letters to newspapers or politicians, political campaigning, [[economic activism]] such as [[boycott]]s or preferentially patronizing businesses, rallies, [[Demonstration (people)|street marches]], [[strike action|strikes]], both [[sit-ins]] and [[hunger strike]]s.
Some activists try to persuade people to change their behavior directly, rather than persuade governments to change laws. The [[cooperative movement]] seeks to build new institutions which conform to cooperative principles, and generally does not lobby or protest politically.
